block.p: Ingrid Kepner Nordquist, a daughter of Dr. Barbara Nordquist and Dr. Myron Nordquist of Bethesda, Md., was married yesterday to John Carter Houghton, a son of the Rev. Alanson B. Houghton II of Pawleys Island, S.C., and the late Lyle Stewart Houghton. The Rev. Thomas Omholt performed the ceremony, in which the bridegroom's father, an Episcopal priest, took part, at St. Paul's Lutheran Church in Washington.
Mr. and Mrs. Houghton met at the University of Virginia, where the bride received a bachelor's degree in environmental science and mathematics and the bridegroom received an M.B.A. degree.

Ingrid Kepner Nordquist, a daughter of Dr. Barbara Nordquist and Dr. Myron Nordquist of Bethesda, Md., was married yesterday to John Carter Houghton, a son of the Rev. Alanson B. Houghton II of Pawleys Island, S.C., and the late Lyle Stewart Houghton. The Rev. Thomas Omholt performed the ceremony, in which the bridegroom's father, an Episcopal priest, took part, at St. Paul's Lutheran Church in Washington.
Mr. and Mrs. Houghton met at the University of Virginia, where the bride received a bachelor's degree in environmental science and mathematics and the bridegroom received an M.B.A. degree.

Mrs. Houghton, 24, will begin her third year at the Cornell University Law School in August. Her father is the legislative counsel to Senator Conrad Burns of Montana and the deputy director of the Center for Oceans, Law and Policy at the University of Virginia Law School in Charlottesville. Her mother is a professor of art at Howard University in Washington.

Mr. Houghton, 31, is a product line manager for Corning Inc. in Corning, N.Y. He graduated from the University of Richmond. His father retired as the rector of the Church of the Heavenly Rest in New York. The bridegroom is a grandson of the late Amory Houghton Sr., who was a chairman of Corning Glass Works and an ambassador to France.
